description.description: Bank transfersÂ are usually fast and easy, however there are a few instances when they can take longer to go through.Â

content.value: Bank transfersÂ are usually fast and easy, however there are a few instances when they can take longer to clear.Â
MostÂ bank transfersÂ can be done by logging into yourÂ online accountÂ or by using your bank'sÂ telephone bankingÂ service. All you need is:
The date you'd like the payment to be made
The name of the person or business you're paying
The six-digit sort code
The eight-digitÂ account number
A payment reference is also helpful so the person or business you're transferring to knows who it is from.

Bank transfersÂ and payments made usingÂ Faster PaymentsÂ should arrive in theÂ payeeÂ account immediately, however sometimes it can take up to two hours to go through. Most banks have a limit of Â£10,000 but some have higher limits and so it's worth checking this with your bank if you're transferring a large amount.

If you're usingÂ BacsÂ payments to transfer money, these can take up to three days, whilst transfers made through theÂ Clearing HouseÂ Automated Payment System (CHAPS) will usually go through on the same day (but the payment needs to be made before a certain time).
However, banks donâ€™t
always

allow instant transfers to otherÂ bank accounts. This is to reduce the risk of fraud. TheÂ receiving bankÂ sometimes takes a few days to release funds to customers to ensure that itâ€™s not a fraudulent bank transaction.
Also, if yourÂ bank transferÂ is to aÂ credit cardÂ account, your money might take more time than usual to show up.
It's also important to keep in mind that you can't take back or cancel aÂ Faster PaymentÂ transaction once it's gone through and so you'd need to contact theÂ payeeÂ to get it back.
How do I make aÂ bank transferÂ at Monzo?

You can send aÂ bank transferÂ to anyone with a UKÂ bank account. Youâ€™ll need the name of the person or company youâ€™re sending it to, and theirÂ account numberÂ and sort code. Transfers should happen instantly, but can sometimes take up to 2 hours. To send a transfer:
Go to your Payments tab.
Tap Bank transfer and follow the instructions.
If you plan to make a transfer over Â£10,000 you'll need to get in touch with our team to raise your limits, and that this can take a few hours.
You can also makeÂ international transfersÂ using our Transferwise integration, unfortunately at this point in time you can't receiveÂ international transfersÂ into your account.
If you want to send a payment to someone on Monzo, you just need to have them as a contact in your phone!
You can also try pay someone using Nearby Friends, which lets you pay people through bluetooth.
Go to the Payments screen, and make sure you've both got Bluetooth switched on.
Both tap Nearby Friends, then tap your friend when their name pops up.
